intro: Cerastium qingliangfengicum, commonly known as the Qingliangfeng alpine mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of white flowers. The plant thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in rocky or alpine meadows. It has adapted to the cold, arid conditions of its habitat through its compact growth form and specialized root system. Cerastium qingliangfengicum plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native region.
